info.description:
Docs for defillama's open API

Need higher rate limits or priority support? We offer a premium plan for 300$/mo. To get it, email 0xngmi@llama.fi
info.title: DefiLlama API

get.summary: Get current TVL of all chains
Get current prices of tokens by contract address
get.description:
The goal of this API is to price as many tokens as possible, including exotic ones that never get traded, which makes them impossible to price by looking at markets.

The base of our data are prices pulled from coingecko, which is then extended through multiple means:
- We price all bridged tokens by using the price of the token in it's original chain, so we fetch all bridged versions of USDC on arbitrum, fantom, avax... and price all them using the price for the token on Ethereum, which we know. Right now we support 10 different bridging protocols.
- We have multiple adapters to price specialized sets of tokens by running custom code:
  - We price yearn's yToken LPs by checking how much underlying token can be withdrawn for each LP
  - Aave, compound and euler LP tokens are also priced based on their relationship against underlying tokens
  - Uniswap, curve, balancer and stargate LPs are priced using the underlying tokens in each pair
  - GMX's GLP token is priced based on the value of tokens given on withdrawal (which includes calculations based on trader's PnL)
  
  - Synthetix tokens are priced using forex prices of the coin they are pegged to
- For tokens that we haven't been able to price in any other way, we find the pool with most liquidity for each on uniswap, curve and serum and then use the prices provided on those exchanges.
  
  Unlike all the other tokens, we can't confirm that these prices are correct, so we only ingest the ones that have sufficient liquidity and, even in that case, we attach a `confidence` value to them that is related to the depth of liquidity and which represents our confidence in the quality of each price. API consumers can choose to filter out prices with low confidence values.
  
 Our API server is fully open source and we are constantly adding more pricing adapters, extending the amount of tokens we support.
  
Tokens are queried using {chain}:{address}, where chain is an identifier such as ethereum, bsc, polygon, avax... You can also get tokens by coingecko id by setting `coingecko` as the chain, eg: coingecko:ethereum, coingecko:bitcoin. Examples:
  - ethereum:0xdF574c24545E5FfEcb9a659c229253D4111d87e1
  - bsc:0x762539b45a1dcce3d36d080f74d1aed37844b878
  - coingecko:ethereum
  - arbitrum:0x4277f8f2c384827b5273592ff7cebd9f2c1ac258

parameters.name: coins
parameters.description: set of comma-separated tokens defined as {chain}:{address}

parameters.name: searchWidth
parameters.description: time range on either side to find price data, defaults to 6 hours

get.summary: Get historical prices of tokens by contract address
get.description: See /prices/current for explanation on how prices are sourced.

parameters.name: coins
parameters.description: set of comma-separated tokens defined as {chain}:{address}

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: UNIX timestamp of time when you want historical prices

parameters.name: searchWidth
parameters.description: time range on either side to find price data, defaults to 6 hours

get.summary: Get historical prices for multiple tokens at multiple different timestamps
get.description:
Strings accepted by period and searchWidth:
Can use regular chart candle notion like ‘4h’ etc where:
W = week, D = day, H = hour, M = minute (not case sensitive)

parameters.name: coins
parameters.description: object where keys are coins in the form {chain}:{address}, and values are arrays of requested timestamps

parameters.name: searchWidth
parameters.description: time range on either side to find price data, defaults to 6 hours

get.summary: Get token prices at regular time intervals
get.description:
Strings accepted by period and searchWidth:
Can use regular chart candle notion like ‘4h’ etc where:
W = week, D = day, H = hour, M = minute (not case sensitive)

parameters.name: coins
parameters.description: set of comma-separated tokens defined as {chain}:{address}

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: unix timestamp of earliest data point requested

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: unix timestamp of latest data point requested

parameters.name: span
parameters.description: number of data points returned, defaults to 0

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: duration between data points, defaults to 24 hours

parameters.name: searchWidth
parameters.description: time range on either side to find price data, defaults to 10% of period

get.summary: Get percentage change in price over time
get.description:
Strings accepted by period:
Can use regular chart candle notion like ‘4h’ etc where:
W = week, D = day, H = hour, M = minute (not case sensitive)

parameters.name: coins
parameters.description: set of comma-separated tokens defined as {chain}:{address}

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: timestamp of data point requested, defaults to time now

parameters.name: lookForward
parameters.description: whether you want the duration after your given timestamp or not, defaults to false (looking back)

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: duration between data points, defaults to 24 hours

get.summary: Get earliest timestamp price record for coins

parameters.name: coins
parameters.description: set of comma-separated tokens defined as {chain}:{address}

get.summary: Get the closest block to a timestamp
get.description:
Runs binary search over a blockchain's blocks to get the closest one to a timestamp.
Every time this is run we add new data to our database, so each query permanently speeds up future queries.

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: Chain which you want to get the block from

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: UNIX timestamp of the block you are searching for

get.summary: Get the ABI for a function or event signature.

parameters.name: functions
parameters.description: function 4 byte signatures, you can add many signatures by joining them with ','

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: event signatures, you can add many signatures by joining them with ','

get.summary: Get the verbose ABI for a function or event signature for a particular contract

parameters.description: Chain the smart contract is located in

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address of the smart contract

parameters.name: functions
parameters.description: function 4 byte signatures, you can add many signatures by joining them with ','

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: event signatures, you can add many signatures by joining them with ','

get.summary: List all bridges along with summaries of recent bridge volumes.

parameters.name: includeChains
parameters.description: set whether to include current previous day volume breakdown by chain

get.summary: Get summary of bridge volume and volume breakdown by chain

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: bridge ID, you can get these from /bridges

get.summary: Get historical volumes for a bridge, chain, or bridge on a particular chain

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: chain slug, you can get these from /chains. Call also use 'all' for volume on all chains.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: bridge ID, you can get these from /bridges

get.summary: Get a 24hr token and address volume breakdown for a bridge

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Unix timestamp. Data returned will be for the 24hr period starting at 00:00 UTC that the timestamp lands in.

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: chain slug, you can get these from /chains.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: bridge ID, you can get these from /bridges

get.summary: Get all transactions for a bridge within a date range

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: bridge ID, you can get these from /bridges

parameters.name: starttimestamp
parameters.description: start timestamp (Unix Timestamp) for date range

parameters.name: endtimestamp
parameters.description: end timestamp (Unix timestamp) for date range

parameters.name: sourcechain
parameters.description: Returns only transactions that are bridging from the specified source chain.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Returns only transactions with specified address as "from" or "to". Addresses are quried in the form {chain}:{address}, where chain is an identifier such as ethereum, bsc, polygon, avax... .

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit to number of transactions returned, maximum is 6000

get.summary: List all dexs along with summaries of their volumes and dataType history data

parameters.name: excludeTotalDataChart
parameters.description: true to exclude aggregated chart from response

parameters.name: excludeTotalDataChartBreakdown
parameters.description: true to exclude broken down chart from response

parameters.name: dataType
parameters.description: Desired data type, dailyVolume by default.

parameters.description: Desired data type, dailyVolume by default.
